website_summaries.verdict: Extremely low price point for this type of tool, but it will be limited to jobs that don't require high power levels.
pros: Offers 2 power settings that are convenient to adjust on the fly
Easy to switch between forward and reverse functions
Runs more quietly than most air impact wrenches
Will work well with a smaller air compressor
Nice entry-level tool for basic jobs, because it doesn't really offer torque for tough jobs
cons: Heavier gun that may cause fatigue over time

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy, and strong
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Impact's since 1968, started in a gas station mounting tires. This is a near copy of a Ingersol Rand impact which I owned in the late 80's early 90's. Have been using this one since mid April this year. It is sturdy, and strong. Today I work in Transit / Transportation field, Semi trucks and trailers. It is holding up quite well. This impact is a very good deal. I am glad I took the chance, I am satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lliam Mckenzie

customer_reviews.title: Tips for use with a smaller compressor
customer_reviews.text: Great impact wrench. The manufacturer recommends a 20+ gallon air compressor, however it is possible to use it with a smaller one with some modifications on how you use it. Make sure your regulator is set to 90 PSI and then PULSE the trigger - don't hold it down. Squeeze the trigger fast and in short bursts, allowing your line to recharge with 90 PSI in between pulses. Using this method I was able to take off lug nuts on my F-350 which were torqued to 150 ft lbs as well as rusty frame and brake caliper bolts that I'm sure would have taken more torque than that. I use it with a.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: and this buzzed them off like they were greased
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any way to measure the torque this is putting out, but I ordered this because the Craftsman I have with 340 foot pounds advertised wouldn't budge the bolts on my mower blades, and this buzzed them off like they were greased. It also took the winter tires off both of our vehicles and removed the rusty lug nuts from my utility trailer in the past week. For what I paid for this, I feel like it's a very tough impact wrench. It also came with an air fitting and bottle of oil.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy and quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical ordering a impact wrench that was the third of the price as some name brands. I could not be happier. The PowRyte delivered consistent and effective torque all day today during a comprehensive rebuild of the front and rear end of my vehicle. Struts, control arm bolts and stubborn brake brackets were removed easily. Please note that a 3/8 hose must be used for effective functionality. I will purchase more products from this company. Thanks! (Update) I have now purchased a second unit to supplement the first one in the review. What a great deal. These perform better than some name brand $200 units. I am really satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Ralphie

customer_reviews.title: RowRyte 1/2" Impact Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great impact for the price!! I use this with my 2 stage 80 gallon air compressor and I can remove all 4 wheels and a lot more before my compressor kicks on to refill. Lug nuts are no problem and this is very useful for corroded bolts like wheel bearing mounting bolts. Ive removed these with a 1/2" ratchet and it sucks; it takes forever and my arms are wore out! With a good impact swivel and socket these still take some time but the impact does all the work! Just let it hammer away with the decent torque!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Sockets fall off.
customer_reviews.text: Seems beefy enough except the hog ring (I think that's what it is called) would not hold any of my sockets or extension bars on. Sending it back for that reason. Seems to have great power otherwise. Probably could've removed the hog ring and stretched it a tad to make my sockets fit but I didn't want to do that. Seller later reached out to me and made things right. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be well made and sturdy. It comes with the connector for the air ...
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be well made and sturdy. It comes with the connector for the air hose. My previous Air Impact Wrenches did not include the connector. It worked great the only time I have used it. It comes with a brief instruction manual. It tells you that it must be oiled regularly, but it does not tell you how to oil it or what oil to use. I will only use this 10-12 times a year, so it's too early to predict durability, I am pleased with this wrench after 1 use.
customer_reviews.author: old coach

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions: good weight, balance could be better but it isn't terrible. This wrench pounded off lug nuts torqued at 97ft lbs .. at 90 psi with an 11 gal compressor Make sure you oil before every use! Will review months later to see if it lasts
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: easily on par with all of the other $100 and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've seen this air gun on here for $40 twice and I have bought it twice. I work at an auto shop and at $40 this is an incredible gun, easily on par with all of the other $100 and up guns in my shop. If you need more power than this you're going to have to drop at least a couple hundred on a gun with over 1000 ftlbs torque.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in one job, with brute Force!
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this bumper off with hand wrenches, and I did not want to use a breaker bar as I had just hurt my back. So off the jump I didn't have much faith in this being a cheaper model, boy was I wrong!! I also thought I was gonna have to use my earthquake HF, or air cat on something that was this frozen (stock 97 suburban bumper never touched or removed). I figured why not try full torque? It came out so fast it sparked against the surface, I was expecting a big struggle and a lot of slow movement. Wow thing puts out, hope it holds up although it has already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: i just broke the crank bolt loose with ease, 1999 Honda Accord
customer_reviews.text: First review Ive ever done, customer since 2002. I was initially impressed when i broke loose both axle nuts on my Honda accord, after i broke my 1/2" breaker bar on the first one. However.... Tonight i just broke the crank bolt loose with ease, 1999 Honda Accord that's never seen a timing belt change.. just WOW!! Set it on 5, pressure a little high at about 105psi. I also use Flexzilla high flow couplers -- here -
customer_reviews.author: justme414

customer_reviews.title: It has no power and feels like it is low quality
customer_reviews.text: This was not worth it. I bought it to remove a couple big bolts on my cards engine mounts. They did not move an inch. Tried to detach the driveline. No movement. Using a socket wrench however I had no problem loosening them up. So whats it good for. Maybe to change tires, but thats it.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Zoller

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money! A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money! Works great use it everyday at work! Would buy again look forward to getting more of their tools to test at work! I put in tires all day and it feels right in the hand!
customer_reviews.author: julian742

customer_reviews.title: SMALL BUT POWERFUL IMPACT WRENCH
customer_reviews.text: FOR THE PRICE, THIS IS A POWERFUL WRENCH, REMOVES LUG NUTS FROM LARGE TRUCKS, AND IS RELATIVELY LIGHT. GREAT PRODUCT. I WOULD BUY IT AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible gun and now I can’t return it
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy, I’ve owned for 8 months and have literally only used it 3 times and it failed yesterday. Something broken inside as I can hold the end and depress the trigger and nothing happens. Air just shoots out of the bottom..... Horrible gun and now I can’t return it. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff.R35

customer_reviews.title: This is a good one!
customer_reviews.text: This is the one you want if you have a typical compressor. This thing packs enough punch on smaller compressors 125 PSI and under to remove those stubborn lug nuts and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Thanks., very affordable!.. took my ...
customer_reviews.text: Thanks. , very affordable!..took my tires off and put them back on so quick , with a 6 gallon 120 psi. So far it's worth the price and time!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power and well built. Takes of lug nuts off like butter without pre loosening. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: dante thomas

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to take a wheel off a backhoe. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take a wheel off a backhoe. I used a 15 gal snap-on air compressor at 90psi, 1&1/8" impact socket with 3/4" adapter, and pb blaster. It struggled and I tapped the lugs intermittently with a hammer but it eventually took them off. I was pleasantly surprised. 4 stars only because I have no idea yet how long the tool will last
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Very strong gun
customer_reviews.text: Very strong gun. This was able to loosen some big stuff my other inpact gun couldn't touch. Well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Throttle Shop

customer_reviews.title: My first pneumatic tool!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe all the car work I have done without this tool. Well worth the money. Seems to have plenty of power. Big time saver!
customer_reviews.author: nicks

customer_reviews.title: Impressive power for an inexpensive tool!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to connect this to my compressor and was removing lugs in minutes! I admit, I didn't know what to expect since the price was quite a bit less than its competitors, but it has worked out great!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for mounting my car tires. Well built and good balance. I'm very pleased and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Tache

customer_reviews.title: Best one I have ever got
customer_reviews.text: Best one I have ever got. Has a lot of power. Use it for my semi truck when taking off things. I really recommend it. And cheap and amazing
customer_reviews.author: Mirnes Miki

customer_reviews.title: Quick mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I have just used it to remove all four tires to do a brake job works great. I don't know about durability but it's heavy made.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Waddell

customer_reviews.title: Torque at a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, made my el cheapo impact gun from CH look like a screw driver in a child's hands. It easily removed a high torqued axel nut and my lug nuts!
customer_reviews.author: L. Chouinard

customer_reviews.title: works well to install lots of lag bolts on my ...
customer_reviews.text: works well to install lots of lag bolts on my deck project. needs lots of air so a compressor with a large tank is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much since it is new but the one time I did use it and seemed to be strong and working good. The air nipple that came with it did not fit on my hose, but after changing that it hooked right up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for switching tires!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this impact wrench to remove lugs to switch summer and winter tires. Did a great job. My compressor is a bit small, so I need to wait a bit between lugs but this is a compressor issue not a wrench issue. I highly recommend this wrench.
customer_reviews.author: UtahJohn

customer_reviews.title: Mine broke
customer_reviews.text: I guess I wasn't as lucky as everybody else seeing as mine broke withen 2 weeks of normal use and regular oiling. Would not purchase again.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Impact Wrench
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use this to quickly loosen tight nuts on my riding mower blades and my brush cutter blades. Serves its purpose very well for thes smaller jobs. Made in China, but instructions for use and care are clear.
customer_reviews.author: Alamo Sam

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform as expected
customer_reviews.text: Tthis air wrench does not have enough power, I tried to use it on my 2007 Ford Expedition, which has lug nuts torqued at 150 lbs, and it was unable to take them off. This tool maybe great for other lug nuts that are torqued at a lower level.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It works very well, breaking loose most rusted on bolts. Ones it can't, I just apply a little bit of heat and it'll work. Cheap, but well made. One of the best tools I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Ayrnan H.

customer_reviews.title: Great impact gun!
customer_reviews.text: Great impact gun! I did a lot of reading and decided on this one. It works very well and good quality

customer_reviews.title: This is a great low priced impact wrench
customer_reviews.text: This is a great low priced impact wrench. I removed a bolt tightened to 400 ft-lb on my F-150 (lower front strut) using this and a little 3-gallon compressor with little or no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for Price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good torque for price. Has some factory chowder in it when I took it apart. Thats to be expected with cheap tools though.
customer_reviews.author: M. Steele

customer_reviews.title: Works great with correct air line size.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, plenty of power removing lug nuts from my truck. Be sure to use the correct size air line otherwise it will be really weak. Can't beat the price for this much power.

customer_reviews.title: Great Air impact wrench!!

customer_reviews.text: Very powerful impact gun I used it couple times already since I’m a mechanic and it works really good for what I paid it’s good product

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good heavy duty impact wrench, a little heavy to hold but is very strong. A

customer_reviews.text: This impact wrench makes removing rusty nuts & bolts a breeze. Highly recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: So far no complain at all. It has enough ...
customer_reviews.text: So far no complain at all. It has enough power to remove the wheel nuts with the small size compressor. Not sure what might go wrong with those reviewer who claimed this wrench not working.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's a nice 1/2 for general work.working in plant with limited air but overall.cant complain.

customer_reviews.text: Impact Wrench arrived on time and well packaged. I immediately used it to remove an axle nut on my 1977 MGB that I struggled with previously. It worked great. I should have bought it years ago.

customer_reviews.text: At 90 PSI, they removed my lug nuts without any problem. Just make sure you have the selector knob set at #5 while removing lugs and at #1 or #2 while tightening them, because you might ring them out on a setting higher than #2.

customer_reviews.title: if you need one buy it cause it works!!!

customer_reviews.title: I have no qualms with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It's got balls. I use it in a factory setting and it is extremely useful. I was worried due to how much it costs but I have to say I'm glad I made the purchase. This thing is beast and comfortable as well. Really like it. I'm sure you will too. Powryte is actually a pretty awesome company. Hope they excel to do more. Comes with adapter as well. Why not 5 stars? Because I don't trust 5 stars.. but 4 or below I do for the most part.

customer_reviews.title: No problem with this product I loved it

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on two old and very stuck bathtub drains that I couldn't remove any other way.
customer_reviews.text: I've been needing a good heavy duty impact wrench. A recent project where I simply could not remove two old and very stuck bathtub drains to replace them, not even with a breaker bar, convinced me I needed to stop putting off buying an impact wrench. With the PowRyte impact wrench, I had the drains removed in under 30 seconds. I'm glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash, I've used this for a while now ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute trash, I've used this for a while now and compared it to other guns and my Milwaukee mini impact the m12 kind has way more power... way more. This gun seriously has 20 ftlbs maybe. It's unreal. Can't spin bolts that I can move with a 2 foot bar and one finger.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.  Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a basic tool. Got the job done (breaking free a bolt from an exhaust flange) but I don't know how well it would handle tougher jobs. Bought this to replace my old Craftsman 1/2" air impact (which was more or less completely useless); this is certainly much better.
customer_reviews.author: Martin E

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool with the right compressor
customer_reviews.text: Not enough torque at 100 PSI so make sure you have a big compressor at least 150 psi and great recovery. Returned and purchased Dewalt 899 20v 1/2" Impact wrench that works great. Has not failed me yet with rusted or hard to remove nuts/bolts.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Very low power. I'm not sure if I just ...
customer_reviews.text: Very low power. I'm not sure if I just ended up with a dud, but this unit could not break loose lug nuts on a Ford Focus. It was run at the proper 90 PSI, and using the proper 3/8" high flow fitting. I couldn't imagine this thing trying to bust loose a rusted bolt. I returned this after the very first use.
customer_reviews.author: Leah W.

customer_reviews.title: keep on looking
customer_reviews.text: wont even take a lug nut off need I say more

product_meta.title: PowRyte 1/2-Inch Air Impact Wrench, 600 ft-lbs, Twin Hammer
product_meta.description:
Description: 
PowRyte 1/2-Inch Twin Hammer Air Impact Wrench is perfect for tire rotation, brake repairs, exhaust repairs, and the loosening or tightening of any other bolts. Hard hitting twin hammer provides reliability and high torque output. It has an adjustable torque regulator with 2 forward torque settings and 1 reverse setting, and the forward/reverse control makes it easy to switch directions. With easily adjustable torque controls, it allows you to have variable adjustments with forward and reverse settings. It also features an ergonomic handle, a ring type retainer, and built-in silencing reduces noise level.

Specification:
Drive size 1/2 in 
Clutch type Twin hammer 
Maximum Speed 7000 rpm
Maximum Torque 600 ft. lbs
Working Pressure 90 PSI
Average Air Consumption 4CFM @ 90 PSI
Air Inlet 1/4 -18NPT
Recommended hose size 3/8 in. 
Housing Material Die-cast Aluminum

Inculde:
1/4" Male Plug

About PowRyte:
Save Most Live Best. With Eosmos’ innovative company structure and advanced native management system, we save your money in every step of our operation, with a guarantee of high-quality and reliability. We deliver the most saving and best value to you. 
Shop now with PowRyte and you will never worry about overpaying anything. Specifically designed for entry level DIY workers, PowRyte tools maximizes your saving by delivering quality tools with the LOWEST PRICES throughout the market.
feature_bullets: Hard hitting twin hammer provides reliability and high torque output
Full power in reverse and adjustable 2-position power in forward for instant change of power
Built-in Forward/Reverse Switch for quick and easy switching
600 ft-lb of max torque, 7000rpm Free Speed @90PSI
